Package neureka.backend.api

Interface Algorithm

All Superinterfaces:
ADSupportPredicate, Execution, SuitabilityPredicate
All Known Subinterfaces:
DeviceAlgorithm<C>
All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractDeviceAlgorithm, AbstractFunAlgorithm, AbstractFunDeviceAlgorithm, BiElementwise, BiScalarBroadcast, Broadcast, DotProductAlgorithm, ElementwiseAlgorithm, FallbackAlgorithm, FunAlgorithm, FunDeviceAlgorithm, MatMulAlgorithm, NDConvolution, ScalarAlgorithm, ScalarBroadcast, ScalarSumAlgorithm, SumAlgorithm
public interface Algorithm extends SuitabilityPredicate, ADSupportPredicate, Execution
This class is the middle layer of the 3 tier compositional architecture of this backend, which consists of Operations, Algorithms and in case of a DeviceAlgorithm also ImplementationFor.
Conceptually an implementation of the Algorithm interface represents "a sub-kind of operation" for an instance of an implementation of the Operation interface.
The "+" operator for example has different Algorithm instances tailored to specific requirements originating from different ExecutionCall instances with unique arguments. Tensor instances within an execution call having the same shape would cause the Operation instance to choose an Algorithm instance which is responsible for performing element-wise operations, whereas otherwise the Broadcast algorithm might be called to perform the operation.
